intro: Buchnera masuria, commonly known as the common tansy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbrella-like clusters. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often growing in moist, shaded areas. Buchnera masuria is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine. Its botanical features make it easily distinguishable from other members of its family.
